text: Bleasdalea is a genus of flowering plants in the family Proteaceae. ==Taxonomy== Molecular and morphological analysis shows this genus is most closely related to the genus Hicksbeachia, ancestors of the two genera having diverged around 15 million years ago in the Miocene. ===Species=== The genus comprises two species which are native to north-east Australia and New Guinea: *Bleasdalea bleasdalei *Bleasdalea papuana (Diels) Domin ==References== Category:Proteaceae genera Category:Flora of Oceania Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Bleasdalea
